New Records: The White Sox extended their franchise record with their 111th loss of the season.
The White Sox clinched their 19th consecutive series loss.
Key Match Events: The Boston Red Sox scored four runs in the first inning, including a two-run home run by Tyler O'Neill.
Andrew Vaughn hit a two-run home run for the White Sox in the first inning.
Tyler O'Neill hit another home run in the fifth inning, putting the Red Sox ahead 7-2.
Andrew Benintendi hit a three-run home run in the seventh inning for the White Sox.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore commented on Garrett Crochet's tough outing and the team's need to play better to stay in games.
Andrew Vaughn emphasized the importance of showing up every day and working hard for the final stretch of the season.
